column1: "urllink marcy my mother my friend and me STRONG! "
"urllink my school "

"we had an interesting cross cultural workshop today about why israeli are the way they are and where they coming from and how to deal with them and adjust to living here some of it was pretty heavy so here what i wrote as i was processing it all israel is a heavy place the heat and weight come down on you the second your foot touches holy ground i feel it pressing a burden i am not prepared to carry how can anyone be ready for a place like this the quiet sadness the silent pain a country in mourning living day to day and here i am will i be crushed by this or will i learn to share the burden to take part of it upon myself and live here day to day without falling apart will i grow the thick sabra skin i must i think if i am to survive this if i am to move on "

"last night i saw a movie at the film festival entitled it was about the security fence and it was very one sided not very pro the fence it was incredibly depressing very focused on the disadvantages cost and the compromises to the palestinians rights then at the end they showed images of the palestinians climbing over parts of the wall or through the barbed wire to get to work not to bomb buses mind you DOTS but still DOTS the worst part was that i was just as disturbed by those images as i was by the situation and the disadvantages the palestinian people most of whom are not terrorists are facing what kind of person does that make me that i concerned for their rights but only until i faced with my own vulnerability when did my right to live become more important than their rights to freedom "

"as some of you may have read or seen on the news there was a bomb in tel aviv yesterday since i am not in tel aviv i just fine so not to worry you would believe how many people parents called to check in on them DOTS we are in a whole other city STRONG! however i wo lie and say that i am unaffected any one who knows me knows how i can let optimism get the best of me i feel like i let the quiet and uneventfulness of the past few months trick me into thinking i was completely safe and with being able to see the security wall from my window DOTS i think i created a false sense of safety for myself and maybe that was necessary in some ways DOTS to get my head around being here and living here DOTS but i feel like if it can happen there it can happen here and to be honest with myself and all of you it probably will now that not to say that i think i in imminent danger i do take buses and that helps my chances a lot i not worried about being directly involved it way more likely that i get hit by a car because the traffic related deaths are way higher here than terrorist related deaths i worried about hearing an explosion about hearing sirens about how it feel to be in a city when something like that happens our interns tell us that the first one is the worst i ca imagine going through it once let alone multiple times i guess time will tell and i am bracing myself because to think otherwise is to lie to myself about where i am living i am not writing this so that you will all worry i do want you all to worry because i am going to be just fine but this website is to share with you my year not just what i doing but what i thinking and how i feeling and that where i am right now god willing the year will go by peacefully and i wo have a year that comes close to resembling the one that my intern sari had when they all had to leave early DOTS god willing i wo have to deal with any of this i was too far from tel aviv to hear the explosion or see the ambulances drive by i was too far to even know it happened until hours later yet somehow that explosion shattered a part of my life too my false sense of security and sadly for the moment my optimism "

"last night a group of us did havdallah in the park by the windmill it was fun and beautiful and creative and it made us feel like we had really made it which we have STRONG! afterwards we went out for dinner to olive and fish which is a great restarant near school and the park and after that we went to a party at a classmates house all around a great evening here are some pictures as well as one that i took earlier in the day of a camel passing through the park as we were hanging out there "
"urllink the camel in the park "
"urllink our havdallah group at olive and fish "
"here are pictures from shabbat dinner we had a good time "
"urllink us all chatting in my apt "
"urllink seth playing my guitar "
"urllink ely marci jill jason dan seth benny katie and i at my house for shabbat "
"urllink katie and i "

"i participated in something amazing last night every year at this time there is an art fair in jerusalem traditionally the artists set up on ben yehuda and there is music and dancing and lots of food and large crowds since the security situation began a few years ago the festival was moved to the gates of the old city this year it was back on ben yehuda for the first time in years everyone turned out the crowds were large and excited and i told it was an evening to come out and say we are not afraid STRONG! and so we did a group of us went and shopped and ate and sang and danced in the street and it was fantastic it was ben yehuda the way i rembd it crowded and thriving and secure there were security guards at the entrance to the festival and circulating through the crowds it felt great to be there and somehow standing up to danger none of us felt unsafe it one thing not to take a bus it another thing not to live your life "
"urllink lisa rachel c me katie and yossi one of our interns "

"we had such a blast last night the interns planned a social event for us at beit ticho which is a very cool restaraunt near ben yehuda it in a large outdoor courtyard with trees and lights and it just beautiful you pay shekels for all you can eat wine cheese breads salads and pasta it was great STRONG! we had a bunch of small tables and we all sort of circulated and got to know each other i met new people and got to know some of the other people i already met much better there was lots of picture taking and at one point or of us got very excited and carried away beaming things to each other on our palm pilots everything you heard about huc students and palm pilots is true we have them we use them and we are slightly obsessed STRONG! anyway it was a great evening here are the pictures "
"urllink katie me and dan "
"urllink katie and i "
"urllink dalia me and rachel such a great gal STRONG! "

"i had quite an exprinc today STRONG! my friends rachel and dan and i met outside my apt to go to the mall while we were waiting outside for the cab becuase we do take buses we saw DOTS coming up the street towards us DOTS two israeli arab boys riding DOTS a donkey STRONG! i could believe it now granted this is israel but this is jerusalem which is a city and i do know about you but i never seen a donkey in a residential part of a city STRONG! i certainly never expected to see one anyway STRONG! it was funny and incredible luckily rachel knows a little arabic and the boys let me take a picture to document the occasion in case no one believes me so here it is STRONG! i register at school tomorrow i will continue to post as amazing things happen "
"urllink these israeli arab boys were riding a donkey down my street STRONG! "
"urllink my first group of shabbat guests STRONG! rachel rachel aaron liz dan katie and rebecca STRONG! "

"well after much preparation and lots of cooking i hosted my first shabbat dinner in my new home STRONG! in addition to my housemate rachel b and her friend katie who arrived this morning i had rachel k and dan over whom i introduced previously and also rachel friend rebecca and aaron and liz kaplan who arrived on rachel b katie and aaron are all in the cantorial program with me so it was great for us all to get a chance to meet each other shabbat was lovely rachel had come over yesterday to help prepare and cook and the lasagne that i made and the stuffed peppers that she made were both very well recieved i attempted carrot soup but it did really DOTS soup DOTS and dan brought a gorgeous salad with the words shabbat shalom carved in hebrew letters out of cuccumber very creative STRONG! we all had a great time and got along really well and so it begins tomorrow there a picnic that dan and rachel k put together and even more people are coming ca wait to meet them all STRONG! anyway here are some pictures from dinner enjoy STRONG! "
"urllink katie dan rachel k and liz "

"what a night STRONG! tonight the social action committee of which i am a part ran a beit cafe coffee house fundraiser with a talent show and silent auction it was fantastic STRONG! the talent acts were great people sang and did funny things anna can cross her toes and ari can play hava nagila on his head STRONG! and the silent auction which i organized went really well all together we raised about nis new israeli shekels which is about us dollars STRONG! what a great feeling STRONG! throughout the evening i had great moments where i look around and be amazed at my fellow classmates if we can have a night like this organized in a few days with a few people and a lot of generosity and talent imagine what we will do and accomplish over the years as we sang and laughed and did mitzvot together i looked around and tried to imagine looking back on this years down the road i can not quite imagine that yet right now it enough to just wonder at and about who will are becomming every day i see our potential individually and collectively a little more clearly i ca wait to continue doing amazing things with these people i am so lucky to be a part of this pictures of tonight and the galillee trip to be posted tomorrow after i steal them from katie STRONG! "

"on wednesday we ended ulpan early and boarded buses to the gallilee for a day adventure we travelled towards the north of israel making stops along the way to learn about the first aliyah we went to the rothchild gardens which were beautiful and then to the first aliyah museum in zichron which is a beautiful town to which i had never been to before what a view STRONG! we stayed at a kibbutz near the golan heights where we had evening services where the rooms were super clean i roomed with katie marcy and lisa and where the breakfast was typically israeli then the real fun began we boarded the buses and headed to the jordan river where we went rafting STRONG! so much fun STRONG! the rafts were big and the rapids if you could call them that were miniscule and for the first half of the trip before the tiny rapids began we were alowed to jump in each other boats and thrown people into the water and swim around i did of course get thrown in thanks joel STRONG! but it was refreshing and it made it all the more fun to watch other people get dumped in as well i rafted with rachel david tal sadie and josh super good times after that we had a fantastic lunch at a restaraunt on lake kineret so gorgeous and then went to the cemetary where rachel the poet and naomi shemer are burried to learn about the aliyah seeing their gravestones was moving as i know their poetry and music and have known of them as important israeli figures for most of my life at the end of the day we took the buses back to jerusalem it was good to be home mostly cause we all smelled like the jordan river and really needed to shower STRONG! pictures to follow "

"sometimes i realise things in fleeting moments and it takes a while to get them composed and down on paper or DOTS computer screen rather DOTS it amazing how quickly we all settled in to a routine here i no longer feel that it strange that i live in israel or that i speak and study a different language every day i no longer notice buses driving buy or worry that the parked cars on the street are going to explode as i walk buy them the heat is hardly noticable or bothersome i feel like i known these people forever DOTS it only sometimes moments all too fleeting when i remember why were here how amazing it is that i here that these people are here with me what we doing here working toward i had a moment in ulpan the other day when it occured to me that these people are just classmates they collegues some of the people in my class will be in my classes for the next years some of them will work in the same city as me all of them will be part of my life forever it crazy then tonight i had dinner with katie and lisa and marcy the cantorial crew we brought a chicken to marcy and she made cuscus and it was great just sitting around gabbing and i found myself thinking how great it was that i will have these people in my life now sometimes i get sad when i think about my rabbinic friends who will be at different campuses next year i do have those worries with marcy and the girls i know they not going anywhere anytime soon it comforting and it occured to me that these women are just my collegues they my friends and sitting around and eating and laughing and being rude STRONG! i knew it was more than that they are my family too on a lighter note i stole pictures from katie and marcy today some great ones from hezekiah tunnel and of me being frum in the old city also a great one of katie and dan they all on my webshots page in the trip pictures album enjoy STRONG! "
"attraction is so basic what people need from one another is so much more complex one does not guarantee the other and appologies should not be necessary "

"hang on everyone this is going to be a long entry the day started off with a joke since we had been told to dress appropriately for our visit to the western wall today i decided to go all the way and wear not only a long skirt to ankles but a very head scarf i did it to make my classmates smile and to make a joke of the fact that we ca just go as we are ca just pray as we are can never quite feel accepted in our homeland at our wall anyway it worked for a while my classmates laughed i laughed especially when anna told me that the head scarf indicated to people that i was married STRONG! and it was fun to be in the old city and not get mean looks from the orthodox crowd in fact i got smiles sometimes felt welcome was harrassed by orthodox children raising money for yeshivas who thought i be sympathetic things only got better when i offered to carry my friend jo baby for a while in her snuggly carrier thing boy did i look like a young frum mother pictures to follow sometime soon STRONG! STRONG! little did i know we went to the western wall tunnels which was very cool because i had never been there before what was cool was that the tunnels empty out into the arab quarter of the old city now let me preface this by saying that we were very safe the western wall tunnel people surround departing groups with a team of security men to escort you back to the jewish quarter men who have handguns in hand with their fingers all but on the trigger nobody was going to bother us surrounded by these men and certainly nothing was going to explode in the arab quarter but suddenly it was not so funny to be dressed as an orthodox jew the outfit adopted with the intention of making me feel less conspicuous was suddenly a very big failure luckily the walk back to the jewish quarter was short never have i been so relieved to be surrounded by orthodox jews for a while i even felt safe and then it happened do freak out i fine everything fine after lunch we were heading back towards the western wall area when we found we could go any farthur police had blocked off the bottom of the staircase we were on there was a suspicious object down the street and no one was going anywhere until it had been delt with which means that someone left a backpack somewhere and the whole area had to be blocked off the bomb squad had to come in and it had to be blown up we stood on the stairs for about minutes patiently for the most part i actually did feel scared i was impressed with the policeman and the efficeincy of the whole ordeal people were calm at first but people do like to be caged and in addition to not letting people into the western wall area the police were also not letting anyone out while you would think that when there a bomb scare people would be happy to sit back and listen to the police this is israel and nothing that easy just as we hear the suspicious object being blown up a block or so away something like a soft pop not a big explosion noise a riot breaks out at the gate to the western wall the people wanted out police were running and people were screaming and it was not pleasant actually it was pretty upsetting and a little scary yes that me fine with the suspicious object down the street but scared of riots and upset by the sight of policeman running with raised nightstick type things anyway the whole ordeal left me feeling pretty shaken up today made me feel like i do know who to be more afraid of being too jewish means i may not feel safe around arabs not being jewish enough means i may not feel safe around orthodox jews and in the end it does really matter because all it takes is one person left behind belongings for everyone to be confronted with mortality and for all hell to suddenly break lose most days i feel perfectly safe here most days i argue with others that i probably safer here than in most big cities today made me want to crawl into bed and never come out and in fact for the rest of the day that may be exactly what i do "

"today we had a community service fair so that we could meet people from different organizations and begin to decide where to devote our community service requirement i went over to the young judaea table after reading the description of their program basically they need huc students to help plan lead and facilitate liberal spiritual prayer exprincs services for their group of american college freshmen who are doing a year in israel program these kids have never really been active in religious settings so they want us to help introduce them to different types of prayer and worship styles traditional creative medatative musical so i knew this was right up my ally and in the end it where i going to volunteer all this is well and good but not the point of my story i go up to the table and introduce myself to avi the leader of the program avi points to the canada pin on my bag and says where are you from emma toronto avi me too STRONG! e really a yes e that so cool STRONG! a where did you go to school e queen a oh yeah i worked at york e awesome a what temple do you belong to e i grew up at har zion DOTS a oh STRONG! sheryl nosan was there for a while STRONG! e yeah she great DOTS and now i at kol ami my dad the rabbi there a oh STRONG! you danny daughter STRONG! i love your dad STRONG! i worked with kolel etc etc really close friends with nancy etc etc actually i been to your house before STRONG! e a little weirded out really was i there a probably nancy and david engagement party e i was there STRONG! that really weird a yeah so you doing the second generation thing you dad great he knows my dad actually my dad a rabbi in winnipeg DOTS and it went on from there so this is both funny and frustrating i do know why i thought i could get away from all of that here you think i expect it by now maybe i just sensitive now to wanting to be seen as being here on my own terms we rk rabbi kids and there are a good sized group of us in the program get a lot of oh you an rk no wonder you here and everytime i think gee DOTS thanks for assuming i can think for myself DOTS it funny that these things never really used to bother me i just really do want people thinking i got a free ticket here or that i did come to this calling on my own terms DOTS oh well DOTS what can you do in anycase dad avi rose nathan rose son says hi "

"i somehow forgot to talk about havdallah this past week we a large group of my classmates and i had it at noah and adam house and it was lead by my classmate and friend noam katz who just happens to write amazing jewish music the energy in the room was incredible and i could go on forever about it but my friend leah describes it beautifully on her blog so here what she said last night during havdalah at noah and adam a room teeming with huc students separated the peace of shabbat from the routine of the week as the room filled with song with harmony and beauty love enveloped that space between the sacred and the profane bringing the two together in a dance that embodied the essence of shalem of wholeness of letting go of the rest of the world in search of a peace that is the calm amidst the insanity "

"wow talk about once in a life time exprincs STRONG! last night i went with about half of my classmates to a david broza sunrise concert at massada david broza is a famous israeli musician singer and guitar player some say he is israel version of dave matthews others say eric clapton still others say billy joel DOTS i had heard of david broza before and had in fact seen him in central park when i was on staff at kutz camp and we took the campers to participate in an israel rally i had paid too much attention to him then though because i was doing my job and looking out for the campers so i did go to this concert because i was a fan i went because it was a sunrise concert at massada meaning it began at TIME in the middle of the desert at the base of one of the coolest mountains on the planet and one of my favorite places in isreal and ended with the rising of the sun which i had seen from the top of massada on my nfty israel trip and knew to be an amazing sight about of the huc students went to this concert but we broke ourselves down into smaller groups for the purpose of transportation we went in sheiruts taxi buses some which went straight to massada from jerusalem about hour drive and some like mine which first went to arad where we had to pick up our tickets other people had picked them up in tel aviv earlier in the week arad is a small city just south of massada our group of us in sheiruts left jerusalem at in the evening and drove to arad the drive was beautiful there is a heavyness about jerusalem that you do always feel when you in the city but when it leaves you as you leave the city you notice it between our newfound lightweightedness i think i just created a word and the gorgeous veiw we were elated my last trip to israel was spent mostly in the south so as we drove down into the desert i felt like i was coming home back to a place of familiarity and happy memories anyway we picked up our tickets and went to a bar for dinner and drinks we had a grand old time eating drinking playing pool shmoozing and getting excited for the concert after that we bought tickets for the bus to massada which would leave at TIME TIME since it was only TIME TIME we found a park to chill out in and kill time some of us slept while others played frisbee and chatted those of us that wanted to sleep spread out blankets on the grass and quickly learned that it is very cold in the desert at night despite our various sweatshirts and blankets we were quite cold luckily we are all friendly peaople and did not mind squeezing our bodies close up to one another under one blanket as i lay under the sky in arad shivering i learned two very important things the first is that a tired rachel crossley and a tired emma equal a lot of giln the second thing is that if you ever have to go to a cold country or sleep in a cold desert and you can only take one person with you tal is the person to take he emits warmth STRONG! around TIME TIME we woke ourselves up warmed ourselves up found some bathrooms to use and headed for the bus the bus left on time but took longer than the expected min to get there due to the heavy traffic created by the concert attendants police and security people finally we got there though and it was well worth the wait the concert was set up at the foot of massada at the back between the roman ramp and herod palace for those of you that have been there and know what i talking about we sat in the stands or on blankets and watched the amazing concert broza is an incredible musician and you did have to be familiar with his music in order to appreciate his talent and the atmosphere the concert started in the dark just the lights from the stage then certain parts of massada herod palace for example were lit up and could be seen clearly from where we sat below at one point the whole line of wall at the top of the mountain was lit up it was incredible after hours of great music and moving lighting the sky began to lighten and the mountain and the sea below us began to become more and more visible david worked his music to a climax with everybody favorite songs at the end so we found ourselves standing and singing as the sun rose above us it was truely an amazing moving beautiful morning i am incredibly tired but so glad that i went below is a picture from the concert and you can find more on my album on webshots i will continue to add pictures as well as i get them from friends so check back now and again i going to sleep now it been a long but worthwhile hours a day i will surely never forget "
"urllink david broza and the sky beginns to lighten "

"there are new pictures up on my album care of my friend rachel isaacson there are a few pictures from a few days back when we had a blood drive on campus and then there are two beautiful shots that rachel took from outside the old city of yemin moshe where the windmill is and of the king david hotel and huc enjoy STRONG! urllink "

"i stirred and looked at the clock half past on the clock another busy day i put feet down bent down to touch my feet a morning routine of warming up before i started my daily chores i went out of the room and closed the door quietly behind my back the air outside was cool and humid like every day i checked the lock on the door locked as i had last night i slowly passed the kitchen to the bathroom for a wash up i switched on the water boiler sat on the living room couch am coughed in the next room his cough was getting worse should i send him to school or not better not i take him to the doctor i decided "

"well DOTS well DOTS finally after almost weeks DOTS i get time to set up an account here DOTS this is the second last week of my intern ship needless to say i really loved working here at mikoishi yeah really honestly though i always complained DOTS well DOTS i should have DOTS cuz only i know what it was like working in reuters DOTS that stupid company eom o yea DOTS chris disturbance well i do mind really DOTS i mean DOTS well DOTS he is married i guess DOTS so DOTS anyway i really wonder if that lass he went out with was his gf or someone amy set chris up with i feel real sorry for chris DOTS now i wonder DOTS was he madly infatuated but hey he did even bother asking me DOTS or caring when i had my operation then again was he guarding my privacy o who cares STRONG! now final weeks for my internship and he gets me to sit next to him DOTS emoji DOTS wonder if he feels any difference DOTS DOTS i be going back to school week after next week DOTS then o yea DOTS i make my grand entrance into the seg canteen right haha DOTS i wonder DOTS will those kuttans and kuttis DOTS take notice of me any more DOTS DOTS i guess those ppl got to know that i older than them DOTS d DOTS what a joke STRONG! i believe they din think twice that i might have been DOTS that poor bloke DOTS hahaha d DOTS o well DOTS let see what happens DOTS not to forget serene meet next thursday for the presentation DOTS should i wear the nyp to piss her off d DOTS no DOTS let see what i can come up with that day DOTS "

"category desserts description a delicious but not cake dessert yield thin slices or larger slices ingredients cup no salt cooking margarine or butter plus aditional for greasing cup plus aditional for dusting teaspoons vanilla large cup teaspoons baking slices pineapple cut to cover bottom of pancinamon for sprinkling on pinapple optional preparation the oven to grease a loaf pan around inches sprinkle with and cinamon if desired and arrange the pinapple to cover the entire bottom of pan beat the margarine with the and vanilla can be done with a fork add the eggs and beat until mix add the flour and baking powder and beat until mix place in the pan and bake for hour or until dark golden on to the large amount of eggs in the mixture this cake will be darker when done than it cool remove from pan and enjoy "

"wow DOTS this year went by so fast first year at claremont already over is that weird i mean so many things happened this year and now they gone just like that strange how life progresses life like the gravitron i too scared to go on it and i always left outside looking in watching people strapped in along for the ride while i see them spinning around in a swirling mass of colour the people inside are the they willing to grab life by the horns sorry for the cliche and be whipped in every direction no matter how many times they hurt they still hold on with everthing they got it scary how fast we age yet we never really ask why it happens so fast it just DOTS happens what is age anyway you ca feel it you ca see it but it always with you kinda like air it makes you live everyday makes you strive to achieve anything you want there so much we need to know and learn in such a small amount of time seeing my brother graduating makes me think about this a little more than i have before think about it we expected to be married and starting a family by the age of that only another years away tops my first went by quickly another will come up just as fast who knows what things we gain or lose by then do you actually know what you life going to be like later on no you do and you wo until then but you can steer it in the right direction just by observing people you can tell if they steering themself in the right direction and people my age are it ironic really the people that need the most help do want to ask for it and do take things seriously but the ones that do need the help think they need it only a few people are smart enough to turn their lives around but sometimes they figure it out too late so many things to think about too many things to ponder only in one lifetime do you recieve your opportunities "

"yet another family tiff great timing there too much tension in this house i need to get out of here for a while why does it have to be like this you think we could work stuff out but no we dysfunctional heh but i fine now i let it all out by yelling my brains out about a certain annoying biatch ya know who i talkin arrrgh she just would leave me alone STRONG! you think she would get the hint by now geez DOTS it like everytime you turn around she there STRONG! lol leech STRONG! but hey wutcha gunna do with that damn puddle she do lotsa stuff to you and expect to be liked after she driven the knife into your back like times grrreat DOTS i hate this damn clingy thing i already have a shadow thank you very much STRONG! DOTS i never have a normal life too many things in the way of one well for me anyway everyone seems just so and here i am sulking you may be reading this and saying wtf STRONG! but this is what going on in the inside no one ever sees it except me being happy is so my thing right sure only in school though when i around people i like all my problems just slip away quietly never seen nor thought of when i with friends you guys make me feel waaay better it my escape my sanctuary you may not realize it but you guys do a lot for me for this i thank you it when i at home by myself that this stuff comes back to haunt me sorry grace i being too serious are i well my life is serious so there no helping it that all i got to say for now so peace up lol i so cool do you dare say otherwise STRONG! "

"weird weather we having DOTS i swear it matches my moods all the time STRONG! this morning was so crappy when we played colours then it got prettyful this afternoon i felt really gross this morning too then i was happy now i blah uckyful feelings so many things to think about so many opportunities slipped past me DOTS feels like i been flipped upside down shaken for all i worth and have just been set upright again trying to find your bearings is hard especially at this age i mean there so many things that stand in your way nowadays so much easier when we were little DOTS lol i sound so serious this is like me STRONG! maybe i talking about this because i watched a certain movie on the weekend about not wanting to growing up flying away to neverland DOTS i do admit there advantages and disadvantages but i still do like the thought of it so many mixed feelings to sort out why should i have to go through this it waaay too complicated for my liking guess it just part of the grand design DOTS think i been reading too many fantasy books arrrgh i too naive with the ways of the world wish i was so much i be so much easier to adjust with certain things i walking a path in the dark it seems like i do know where i going tripping and trying to get back up exhausted and bruised struggling to overcome obstacles i ca see until they hit me square in the face DOTS just a little insight on the way i feel sometimes i oblivious and point out the obvious classic combo for an idiot eh i so clueless sometimes DOTS well guess this is all i can write for now kinda drained you know how it is i write in here a little later "

"well have written in here for like the longest time it feels like i found a quote on the internet that inspired me to post something life is a waste of time time is a waste of life so get wasted all of the time and have the time of your life cleverand half true i think sometimes life is a waste of time but rarely time is definitelynota waste of life since without time no life would exist heh the last part is the best buti doubt i wan na get wasted all of the time DOTS oh well back to my world DOTS i felt so bad yesterday i hated myself for it been going onfor thepast week DOTS why do i feel we allare equal it not fair thatsome peolhavsm thingsthat others envy them for it all works out in the end right well where the end and when it coming for many it can never work out completely there only a small possibility that anything will be alright i know i sound so negative but it all true you always want what you ca have and no one ever satisfied with what they do pose there are so many things that can and are denied to you and there nothing you can do about it compensations are what you recieve instead or nothing is given at all i feel like i been denied what i want and denied even a simple compensation instead but there a reason for everything right wrong the only reason i not given the things i want or even desrvth most is because the world is letingohrs lucky on my misfortunes although i do have to take into consideration the unluckyevents that happen to the fortunate sometimes i do see them suffer as much as i usually do though either that or they refuse to show it wish i could refuse to show my sorrow when i been dealt a horrible hand maybe that why better things happen to people who do show their unhappiness fate is weaving my tapestry slowly but surely then snipping the strings faster than the loom can work DOTS "

"ah finally free no school no worries damn it gunna be a nice months off STRONG! "today i discovered a new meaning to the phrase morning aches and pains DOTS last night three of my mates and i went down past mandelieu to a paintball place basically just a couple of old abandoned buildings in a forest and ran around like mad kids shooting at each other with our brand shining new paintball guns this morning i feeling the consequences two large bruises on the front of my left leg one on my arse how quiant DOTS one right in the middle of my back and one on my stomach while you playing you do feel the pain so much it only kicks in the following day when your adrenaline has run out DOTS i know what you thinking you shocked at how a man so civilised and as myself could partake in such a vulgar and childish activity well to put in the words of a great philosopher it wicked no really once you put your protective mask on loaded up your paintball container and checked the air pressure of the gun you already nervous about the fact that you soon going to get shot at by people with as good an aim as your own they carefully aim for your torso and then shoot a dozen shots in quick succesion none of which hit your torso but two of which risk putting you out of the business one of which barely missing your left ear and the rest of which fly past nowhere near you when you on the field breathing heavily into your face mask heart pumping away after legging it across the open field to hide behind a mound of earth so small that even a mole would be embarrased about it you know that any second now you going to hear the sound of shots and hear the paintballs skimming over your head there nothing like it to get the old adrenaline pumping DOTS "

"it starting to get bloody hot down here now popped out down the local supermarket to buy some pepsi and stuff and it was over degrees DOTS had to put the or clim as they call it here on trouble is that it not that nice dry heat you get in some places it quite humid and you end up feeling like you need a cool shower pretty quickly at least the office has even if it is moody it still better than nothing DOTS but it going to get baking pretty soon especially as our office is facing towards the sun all day luckily i share an office with two ladies otherwise the smell would get manky pretty quickly or not how pleasant DOTS "

"dry your eyes mate i know it hard to take but her mind has been made up there plenty more fish in the sea DOTS the chorus from a very original song i heard while i was in england over the weekend the song called dry your eyes mate by a band called the streets here urllink a link to the video it features chris martin from the band coldplay who adds a really nice touch to the song DOTS go ahead and listen to it you may not like it but at least it not like anything you heard before or is it "

"back from england after what must be the shortest weekend ever DOTS does time fly when you having fun i not sure how long it going to take my body to recover from the damage caused by having three full english breakfasts in three days and a full sunday roast lunch but it was certainly worth it STRONG! it was actually sunny for a couple of hours during the weekend too and if that was shocking enough it was warm too STRONG! ok enough of slagging off for now it was that bad did get to nando restaurant though emoji lots of upset people over there due to england losing to portugal on friday in the football match but it seemed to be softened somewhat as both nations have the same patron saint george do ask DOTS so back in france now until august when we off to finland it starting to get really warm now degrees this morning at already STRONG! it actually getting so warm that my mate girlfriend who is always cold has stopped using her hot water bottle in bed at night exactly who needs thermometres when you have a measure as precise as that anyway i still have bruises on my legs from paintball last wednesday STRONG! that ca be a good thing they gone a very greenish yellow that ok though i sure they be joined by some fresh new ones when we next go paintballing DOTS planned for tonight but i too knackered to go and i also going to the dentists at DOTS so we probably go tomorrow or wednesday again the worst thing about going on holiday even for one working day is coming back and finding your inbox full of dozens of new for stuff that had to be done urgently on the day you were off and stuff that has to be done urgently now and stuff that definitely urgently has to be done by tonight at the latest DOTS so back i go to plough through the work "

"crikey the jog was great STRONG! i could have chosen a better day to turn over a new leaf DOTS after yesterday rain and the wind last night the air is so clear that it looks as though you could almost touch the mountains and the sea STRONG! it was tough to get into the rhythm at the beginning as i not exactly been doing much sport lately lazy bugger that i am DOTS but after a couple of minutes it all started to feel good until i got to the big steep hill and then it did feel so good DOTS this hill is really steep though i not pulling your leg it the kind of steep that you have to go up in first gear in a or that if covered in snow in the winter would be considered a black slope for only skiing lunatics to venture down the good thing about a hill like that is that it ca get any worse and once i crawled over the summit it was downhill pretty much all the way from there DOTS minutes it took me not bad for the first time STRONG! luckily at the office we have decent showers and a swimming pool so i could change before going into work the alternative is a pretty picture so do use your imagination DOTS i should really have brought my swimming shorts a quick couple of lengths would been the perfect topping to the jog now i should get some work done that what i being paid to do here after all right emoji here a pic of the bay of cannes this morning click on the pic to link to a bigger version DOTS urllink "

"there something really freaky going on with the weather last year this time the french goverment was issuing warnings on a daily basis about the heat wave and the dryness of the forests and the potential risk of forest fires DOTS this year it the opposite we had for the last couple of days and there were strong winds and even hail in the north of france to top it all off it so cold that tonight i got trousers on STRONG! i know it shocking but it so cold that it would be plain daft to just be wearing my as i do normally ok that might be too much detail for you especially just before but i trying to make a point here global warming people STRONG! time to stop the polluting and start the protecting DOTS speaking of polluting what is it with people who leave the default picture as their msn messenger picture the msn messenger picture is microsoft way of suggesting we be creative it your own personal pixels worth of space to express yourself why waste it on a picture of the windows xp dog i try to change mine every couple of days to suit my mood at the time usually they are variations of my face on for example einstein or the msn messenger icon legless green bloke whatever it is poor thing while i on the subject of liberty of expression for no reason in particular i going to talk about tuesday paintballing session for starters i did get hit STRONG! not once STRONG! am i bloody good or what yes ok or lucky but that beside the point and no i did spend the whole two hours hiding behind a wall keeping a low profile i was out there charging at my mates as if all hell had broken loose and firing paintballs like there was no tomorrow STRONG! admittedly there were a couple of close shaves as i sure i said before there nothing quite so as hearing and seeing paintballs flying either side of your head DOTS but anyway now it is time to get some sleep hopefully if the weather clears up i going to start jogging the trip to and from work tomorrow takes about minutes to walk so jogging should cut it down to about half an hour but it far too easy to let each day go by without doing any exercise especially after a hard day work at the office and there nothing much to jogging you just put your shoes and shorts on and go for it no faffing about DOTS "

"what a week STRONG! feels like the last couple of days have just flown by DOTS but at least now the new i been slaving over is almost ready to go live a couple of performance tweaks here and there some more content to be added and then it be available for the whole world to marvel at STRONG! not to or anything of course DOTS it strange but i am now sure that there are two types of time portals readily available to anyone who wants to exprinc one the first is the shower you get into the shower in the morning turn the water on and by the time you finished you have absolutely no idea how long you been in there for the second is work the kind of work when you so absolutely focused and concentrated on what you doing that suddenly it lunch time going home time admittedly the latter happens less often than the first but both achieve the same effect i know what you thinking what happens if right you in the shower and concentrating on a really involving problem i think that might result in a black hole or a rip in the fabric of itself but i not sure DOTS wicked it just started raining like the rain you see on the discovery channel when they filming in the one moment the air was heavy and dry with thunder claps right above your head and the next it jucking it down as if there was no tomorrow DOTS the chefs from the restaurant next door got soaked since they were eating their dinner outside poor sods by the way did you know that greece won the euro championship greece STRONG! oh happy day STRONG! emoji "

"at last i finally booked my holidays for the finland trip in august unfortunately i need to work at the company helsinki office for nearly two weeks out of the month that we gone which is a bit pants really but my boss is going to be on holiday during that time and she needs me to cover for her DOTS i hoping that we can do the round trip at some point during the holiday but i still have to convince my better half that it worth the extra cost stockholm is a great city but i only visited it twice and i like to spend some more time there sampling the local food and seeing the sights i really am looking forward to the trip this year in the past i guess i been a little apprehensive about going up north but now on top of the other reasons it be great to escape the heat of the south of france for nearly a month one of the things i most looking forward to is the sauna now the saunas in finland mostly are like the skanky jobs you get in your local gym real finnish saunas are little huts out in the middle of the forest by a lake and made of wood they take over an hour to heat up powered by wood from the surrounding forest of course and once they hot the temperature is around degrees celsius not exactly the ideal temperature to preserve in to put it lightly DOTS once you stipped down to your birthday suit either with your better half or your fellow family members you sit in that scorching humid heat occasionaly beating yourself with eucalyptus leaves and chucking water onto the hot coals above the fire for about five minutes after that time when you can practically feel your skin starting to turn pink you open the sauna door leg it down to the nearby lake and quickly wade into the cool refreshing read bloody freezing water before heading back shaking with the cold to the welcoming warmth of the sauna repeat this until you ca take it any more or until the sauna gets too cold and then wash dry off and head inside for some freshly sausages and cider one fantasic thing about the sauna is how fast you get pissed afterwards STRONG! you can just imagine how your body is after all that heat so gulping down a bottle of cool cider is practically like downing a couple of shots of straight vodka on your average evening out quite funny really and definitely a feel good time especially with some decent sausages to accompany it DOTS "
"for no specific reason here is a picture of a camel for your viewing pleasure "

"to my great disbelief and the shock of my fellow paintballers i survived last night round of paintball STRONG! i came away almost unscathed except for a shot in the inner thigh yes far too near that area for my liking DOTS which has left a nasty bruise and a shot on the shoulder and neck neither of which hurt much nor left a buise luckily unfortunately i ca say as much for my mate galak who was pretty hammered the poor bloke he even was shot at less than by fumier not on purpose but because fumier was stressed out and reacted to the sudden appearance of galak round a corner without thinking DOTS i guess that the danger of paintball you just have to trust that your mates are going to shoot you at range directly in the nads even closer to the weekend now with but a few hours to go STRONG! looks like we definitely heading down to the beach on sunday afternoon with galak stef billou and the lot i just hope we manage to find enough empty space on the beach for us all to lie together even if we do we probably spend most of the time playing voleyba in the water again while the ladies work on their tans and reading skills DOTS could get many people excited about the prospect of renting a catmrn though lazy buggers but we see i might be able to persuade them yet STRONG! "

"wicked it practically the weekend STRONG! one more day to go DOTS the clever people over at the weather station have predicted that it going to be degrees and sunny on saturday which means that if we planning on going to the beach we should get there early and leave before noon getting to the beach any time after is asking for trouble what with all the tourists using up every spare grain of sand to lie on getting there at noon is also asking for trouble especially with that kind of heat as you skin will soon feel like it on fire and you look like a tomato even with decent lotion on DOTS i hoping to rent a a small catmrn for four people this weekend and go sailing round the isles de lerins just off the coast of cannes there this place called le sweet where you can rent a decent for euros an hour not much if you can split the cost between four DOTS i not been sailing for years actually not since i completed the catmrn certification course back before i left for uni about the same time as dinosaurs were still roaming the earth DOTS fingers crossed STRONG! i called up ryan air and easyjet to see how much it cost to change the dates of my return flight from helsinki so i be back on august instead of the the result was not encouraging euros STRONG! it actually cheaper to get a direct flight from helsinki to nice at euros DOTS i think i end up doing that but my better half is just going to check to see if there will be any empty friends appartments in the city during the time we there ooh STRONG! already time to call it a day got to get home and ready for paintball STRONG! apparently there are two newbies coming today mates of my mate galak DOTS muha STRONG! poor sods emoji "

"ah lovely jubbly what a perfect start to a day jog into work then go for a swim ca complain really STRONG! might not be the world most job but at least there are some perks DOTS on the though me the eternal pessimist DOTS it starting to get pretty bloody baking in our office now the does work properly since we halfway between either end and we have a large room about facing the sun most of the day it gets quite unpleasant there is a solution working in one underwear but no perhaps that not the most cunning plan pulling the window blinds down helps a bit but then we lose the gorgeous view we have out over the hills and the sea DOTS ok stop complaining james just listen to yourself STRONG! fair enough in other more interesting news the new is well on its way to being released to the public our resident network guru is going to be implementing a test passthrough proxy tomorrow for the site which basically means we can do funky stuff with certain urls among other things to completely change the subject it looks like i be coming back to france early from our planned month in finland working from there is going to be a pain in the posterior and means that we need to stay in helsinki for two full weeks DOTS so i be leaving my better half up there to face the polar bears and i be back here in france all alone for two weeks cue lone violin playing a sad tune nah it be fine and it give me the opportunity to get some work done for my job DOTS actually it be wierd that be the longest time we have been apart for years that violin is still playing you know STRONG! "

"back from my short holiday with two things changed since i left being i now officially well on my way to DOTS and i also well on my way to turning into a leather person an eloquent term for the old people you see on the beach who spend all day there tanning and have skin so tanned it looks like leather DOTS i not really proud of either of the above but neither can be avoided right technically the second could be but there are few things more pleasant than lying on the beach for an hour or two in the early afternoon and soaking up the sun the beaches are starting to get packed now though what with all the tourists coming down here but it not as bad as it will be in august another reason for going to finland STRONG! it gets to the point where you practically ca walk to the sea because people are packed together like sardines DOTS you can imagine the state of the water as well with all those kiddies running around adding their contributions the best thing about going on holiday is not being at work the worst thing about going on holiday is getting back to work having your inbox crammed with urgent things to do and trying to remember everything you had in your mind before you left DOTS last week i was told that my at work twisted his wrist over the weekend so he taken four weeks off for it to heal as he was looking after the web stuff it means that i now have to go back to doing that and drop the siebel implementation project at least until he gets back DOTS i guess i happy about that siebel not the most exciting product to work with to put it lightly STRONG! it supposed to look good on your cv but i reckon that you should get good at doing something you do want to do DOTS right now i off to try and wade through this mountain of work i have to do before hour and minutes left STRONG! "

"that pink concert last night was wicked STRONG! it amazing how someone so small can have such an incredible stage presence DOTS just got back now from lunch went down to cap the nearest big shopping centre and had lunch at the sushi bar there the french are as a general rule much into sushi surprising really when you see how many french people order steak tartare for lunch DOTS that basically really fresh raw beef served with raw onion slices herbs salad and chips i love sushi though i lucky enough not to have had a bad exprinc with it yet unlike some people i know it one of those aquired tastes you generally tend to either pick up later in life or just hate for ever like olives for some people raw fish by itself really is that exciting or especially tasty but when you combine its subtle flavour with sushi rice and soy with a little wasabi sauce you got a taste explosion that lingers deliciously in your mouth until you clear your platate with a thin slice of pickled ginger ready for the next delight DOTS hmm my mouth watering just at the thought of it STRONG! if you not had sushi before but are willing to try even though you may be a little apprehensive of the exprinc i suggest you go to a proper sushi bar with a real preferably old and therefore exprincd sushi chef who prepares the sushi for you in front of your eyes start with some of the less imposing tastes such as a cucumber maki small roll of rice wrapped in dried seaweed and with a cube of cucumer in the middle and dip it into a little soy if you like the taste combination chances are you like the fish sushis too so go for something like a tuna maki like the cucumber one but with a small cube of tuna inside instead most people tend to find that the first time they try fish sushi the thin slice of fish on a portion of rice that it a bit too much to fast so if you are in a sushi bar with a real sushi chef ask him to prepare smaller sized salmon or fatty tuna the best bit of the tuna sushi for you as it is much more easy to handle for your first time DOTS if you like spicy things then you might enjoy dissolving a little of the green wasabi paste into your soy bowl before you dip your sushi into it ok enough about sushi now i need to work DOTS emoji going to see i robot tomorrow night in cannes really looking forward to it "

"that pink concert last night was wicked STRONG! i never been to a live concert before as sad as that is it true DOTS so it was a real exprinc for me there was a band partie in french who were that bad but they still seemed crap compared to pink it amazing how someone so small she really is tiny can have so much stage presence and get the crowd going she even spoke some french during the concert like bonsoir je pink enchanté STRONG! which was quite sweet the crowd loved her the concert was in a town full of bars restaurants and a great place for going out if you lucky enough to find a parking space STRONG! we actually got a ride down with billou james and jeannine james girlfriend in their audi music blaring and hair blowing in the wind it was great if a little cramped with the five of us DOTS the trip back at abou was so great as soon as you start getting away from the sea it starts to get chilly and going at with the roof down you really feel the cold but still one wicked evening i wish we gone to that david guetta live performance down in la siesta last weekend DOTS i sure he back back next year into work again this morning you know you get so used to having good weather here that you do even think that it might rain for example last night when we got back from the concert i shaved so as not to look like a scruff at work and to avoid having to shave before the run in the morning not at one moment did i think that it might be raining in the morning DOTS and you do normally so that when you wake up and it is actually raining you all confused and have to change your plans DOTS that one of the great things about this place STRONG! if you not had sushi before but are willing to try even though you may be a little apprehensive of the exprinc i suggest you go to a proper sushi bar with a real preferably old and therefore exprincd sushi chef who prepares the sushi for you in front of your eyes start with some of the less imposing tastes such as a cucumber maki small roll of rice wrapped in dried seaweed and with a cube of cucumer in the middle and dip it into a little soy if you like the taste combination chances are you like the fish sushis too so go for something like a tuna maki like the cucumber one but with a small cube of tuna inside instead most people tend to find that the first time they try fish sushi the thin slice of fish on a portion of rice that it a bit too much to fast so if you are in a sushi bar with a real sushi chef ask him to prepare smaller sized salmon or fatty tuna the best bit of the tuna sushi for you as it is much more easy to handle for your first time DOTS if you like spicy things then you might enjoy dissolving a little of the green wasabi paste into your soy bowl before you dip your sushi into it ok enough about sushi now i need to work DOTS emoji going to see i robot tomorrow night in cannes really looking forward to it "

which was quite sweet the crowd loved her the concert was in a town full of bars restaurants and a great place for going out if you lucky enough to find a parking space STRONG! we actually got a ride down with billou james and jeannine james girlfriend in their audi music blaring and hair blowing in the wind it was great if a little cramped with the five of us DOTS the trip back at abou was so great as soon as you start getting away from the sea it starts to get chilly and going at with the roof down you really feel the cold but still one wicked evening i wish we gone to that david guetta live performance down in la siesta last weekend DOTS i sure he back back next year into work again this morning you know you get so used to having good weather here that you do even think that it might rain for example last night when we got back from the concert i shaved so as not to look like a scruff at work and to avoid having to shave before the run in the morning not at one moment did i think that it might be raining in the morning DOTS and you do normally so that when you wake up and it is actually raining you all confused and have to change your plans DOTS that one of the great things about this place STRONG! just got back now from lunch went down to cap the nearest big shopping centre and had lunch at the sushi bar there the french are as a general rule much into sushi surprising really when you see how many french people order steak tartare for lunch DOTS that basically really fresh raw beef served with raw onion slices herbs salad and chips i love sushi though i lucky enough not to have had a bad exprinc with it yet unlike some people i know it one of those aquired tastes you generally tend to either pick up later in life or just hate for ever like olives for some people raw fish by itself really is that exciting or especially tasty but when you combine its subtle flavour with sushi rice and soy with a little wasabi sauce you got a taste explosion that lingers deliciously in your mouth until you clear your platate with a thin slice of pickled ginger ready for the next delight DOTS hmm my mouth watering just at the thought of it STRONG! "it the summer that normally means it supposed to be quiet and calm and most people go off on holiday DOTS the only one of those that true in my case is the last one unfortunately STRONG! it really hectic here now what with thierry off on sick leave he twisted his wrist and took six weeks off leaving me with all the crap that he been accumulating over the last couple of weeks and never finished at least the cicadas and their happy continuous chirping are keeping me sane that and running into work in the morning of course it so tempting to stay in the pool after the run and just arse about until lunchtime STRONG! maybe i should try it one day just to freak everyone out at work DOTS on top of all the madness at work i going to have to close down my uk company that was so close to being launched was just waiting for an ok from the bank DOTS due to legal complications basically you ca have a company based and billing in the uk and do most of your work and live outside of the uk well i tell a lie actually you can but you end up needing two accountants one in each country having a tonne of paperwork and spending most of your income on tax social security costs and accountant fees DOTS i was advised by a lawyer friend of ours of another less complex way of doing it so i be looking into that this weekend it really annoying though because i have four completed contracts waiting to be invoiced and another one coming along soon a fair bit of cash it is really tempting to sod this job i working at now well while i not writing my blog of course STRONG! and starting up a proper web business down here i know i love it as developing web sites and tools is what most interests me but fincancially it tricky maybe when my better half gets a job then i consider it more seriously but for the moment we need to have at least one sure source of income DOTS might be going to see pink tonight in concert at just going to ring the fnac ticket place to see if there are any tickets left and how much they cost "

"part four a curious riddle the suite itself was very nice and easy enough to traverse a bed was plainly visible as well as a loveseat coffee table and television an office area consisted of a small glass table and chair the bathroom was an enormous space with one mirror toilet and shower interestingly enough the shower was not physically distinct it boasted neither stall nor basin and instead simply presented itself on one wall of the room maureen explained to me the luxury of space in new york city but still i insisted on knowing how the water from the shower did not end up beneath the sink after some deliberation i contrived a protected position on the loveseat with my hat serving as an ad hoc buffer i resolved not to make with the bed until absolutely necessary maureen joined me fully female and now ordering drinks was i thirsty yes i am fond of beer juice maybe only do add too much juice water is best just be sure put the scotch in first when the room service arrived i hid behind a partition which i now regard as particularly foolish as it only prompted maureen to ask why are you hiding behind the partition i want you to meet someone i was summarily introduced to a hawaiian if you can imagine one of maureen subordinates from the restaurant of the hotel the hawaiian was a fellow and not entirely unsympathetic to the chance of finding his boss alone in a room with a person of questionable income he would return later with more drinks and a complimentary gift from the restaurant staff a hotel hudson intimacy kit in retrospect this hawaiian understood my predicament better than i did neither money nor occasion have i had to purchase such a device in years "

"part three a harrowing journey do you love it scallop maureen asked me two room keys and several elaborate lies later this is where i work is it dreamy and painfully hip i feel like i not appreciating this to my fullest what is that some kind of dance music where are we anyway this is the elevator dear why is there dance music in the elevator what that green halo around everything why ca i see my feet that the ian schrager difference a night so i ca see where i going maureen laughed quit cryin you love it a wall receded before us and after several steps and some examination i satisfied the impression that we were no longer in the elevator maureen was advancing along a narrow corridor interminable in length her eyes no doubt better acclimated to the overpriced gloam despite my relative blindness i kept pace as best i could rarely discerning a floor but rather a succession of lights suspended from either wall not unlike the landing strip of a runway these met me in clusters as i walked and the intervals produced a familiar enough effect we were in among a long arrangement of private rooms proceeding to our own christ will you slow down i gasped anxious lest i speak too loudly and disturb well whatever the hell might be molting down here in maureen materialized and guided me by the hand which is by far my best appendage to be led by although i still held out hope this would not spoil the evening hurry hurry your royal boyness maureen chided the last thing i need is for my boss to find me marshaling men into rooms at discount rates my boss is an oompa loompa from the chocolate factory he has one of the sourest temperaments known to man even too sour to make their famous oompa loompa sour balls he is a little man little hands little nasally voice little hair little teeny feet little closed mind closed shut like a little mouse trap it is STRONG! why even his heart is little but little does he care "

"a man for all treasons part two wartime advantage or no i immediately made haste to apologize for a variety of personal shortcomings my date we will call her maureen would doubtless recognize in the coming hours my sunglae for instance were far too stylish and i feared being mistaken for someone too eager to make a good impression my pants as i have already made mention were a kind of elaborate rag suspended from my hips which i had hoped to conceal as best i could with my large hat but i soon realized this strategy worked best in a seated position that i could not easily reproduce while walking i apologized for my vulnerability to the sun and my constant consumption of water and hourly lavatory constraints mercy on maureen was woman before ever so with regrets STRONG! stop doing that will you she finally told me you fine for some time we walked about the city avoiding a variety of topics and making our way to the hudson hotel pronounced hudson hotel the article is silent the reader may well question the wisdom in booking a hotel room on the first date and i must confess a certain degree of trepidation regarding the matter myself but soon i felt very selfish indeed if soldiers can so bravely answer the call of war then surely i too can unfamiliar females i considered the bravest souls of operation iraqi freedom anyone under attack from the us military and decided that i had it easy and besides maureen had a crazy discount suffice it to say i have never exprincd a hotel so uniquely odd and ostentatiously expensive as hudson hotel maureen had to assure me that i would not be forcibly removed from the establishment at a moments notice so convinced was i to be tromping beyond the privileges of my caste just make sure they know you with me she explained but this proved difficult even for maureen when consulting a front desk about checking in so untenable was the premise that she had reserved a room for me in her name that the general manager a large german was summoned to sort out the whole mess "

"rumsfeld freedom belgian courts are untidy in the un general assembly voted in favor of a treaty authorizing a permanent international court for war crimes the united states china and five other nations opposed the treaty and nations abstained the treaty has been signed by more than nations including the united states and formally came into effect in july when the court was established called the international criminal court and located at the hague it may prosecute war crimes genocide urllink crimes of aggression and crimes against humanity under the bush administration the united states opposed implementation of the treaty out of fear that american officials or military personnel might be arrested abroad on baseless charges in may the united states repudiated its signing of the treaty and indicated that it would refuse to cooperate with the court it subsequently insisted that forces used as un peackrs be exempted prosecution by the court urllink urllink belgium indicts us with war crimes in iraq rumsfeld mad urllink why american officials should be exempted from international law urllink us war crimes from gulf war i urllink interview with former us attorney general ramsey clark on american militarism and international law "

"why did we go to war this is the best my and i can figure out if we find weapons of mass destruction in iraq then it will have been about weapons of mass destruction if we do find weapons of mass destruction in iraq then it will have been about something else we did lie one bush official told abcnews it was just a matter of emphasis in other words the war will ultimately be about whatever we want it to be about and we let you know once we made up our minds so much of this is right out of george orwell in fact because is so often associated with state totalitarianism we do usually apply it to propaganda systems in democratic societies which are usually much more sophisticated and convincing when the only news source in a country is government controlled people know well enough to discount what they hearing this was how i always viewed orwell oceania a kind of clumsy system holding a bludgeon over people heads lest they fall out of line having again recently i think there more to it than this but i will leave that aside for the moment it not as interesting in terms of propaganda because the propaganda is as good if you want to see propaganda that people can invest themselves in you have to look to the free societies what been interesting to me about the iraq war however is just how unsophisticated the propaganda has been orwell oceania had a proclivity to declare itself at war with one country one day only to turn around and deny it the next it had really been at war with someone else the intellectual class writers editors teachers archivists were assigned the task of destroying official records not keeping with current government declarations and to rewrite history according to the new narrative the government of oceania relied on its population being so and apathetic and their attention span so limited that they would remember or would care to remember that just yesterday they were at war with a totally different enemy the purpose of war was simply a means to control the population keep them afraid and provide justification for their detainment or execution if they stepped out of line thus becoming combatants to borrow a term from our current administration and its patriot act legislation normally i would consider our society above so crude a means of persuasion but in the case of wmd it practically right off the pages of orwell most famous novel our administration sends us to war because of the threat we face from iraq and their weapons program that what they sold the war on remember not liberating iraqis or giving a shot to the arm of middle east peace iraq has of thousands of tons of weapons and so on and so forth blair tells his people saddam could prep a warhead with weapons in minutes most of this is never verified who knows where this information is coming from but people begin to accept yes hussein is our greatest threat so we lay waste to the country its communities its infrastructure kill a lot of people some good some bad some theirs some ours and now we ca find any weapons months of searching and zilch tens of thousands of tons of materials and we ca find a goddam firecracker now it comes out well the whole war was really about wmd after all my supervisor is saying i could have told you that of course the war was about that STRONG! and suddenly i am surrounded by experts in the affairs of state and foreign policy who understood this all along are we really that apathetic and distracted not to notice that we went to war for one reason and came out of it going to war for another any other reason christ almighty stop watching the matrix and start paying attention to the matrix around you "

"fourteen sex well we did have sex that for certain the reader may ask how this can be how after all that has been shared so far and with such clarity of purpose just how can it be that intercourse did not announce itself at our chamber door beg pardon for the delay it had come direct from an engagement in the south bronx and conspire to remedy the situation posthaste it is a hard thing to make sense of i will grant you that many have been the evenings since when i have pondered this mystery to my best estimate all the component parts were in place to say nothing of the political justification provided by the war of course it is all too easy too blame oneself in these things for my rather embarrassed station in life say and that is why i prefer to blame my date instead she seemed persistently in a state of not having sex with me for the entire evening and in retrospect it strikes me as grossly inappropriate on the other hand when it comes to sex i am not very persuasive not even to myself and doubtless this contributed rather centrally to the outcome sex is excellent in theory unfortunately in practice it is even better this is a tremendous injustice when you have had any practice since the carter administration doubly so when the only thing you were practicing was catholicism i want no truck with catholicism it is a discussion best left for another time and what can be said of sex in this particular circumstance is pitiful little as such perhaps the reader will grant me reprieve for the duration "

"twelve the ice bucket was nowhere to be found i first ventured to trace the trajectory of its flight from the site of my collapse but this ultimately proved fruitless i could no longer distinguish the direction i was heading from the direction whence i had come a mounting frustration weighed itself upon my spirits prompting me finally to flail and kick about the darkened corridor jerking my already belagurd anatomy hither and thither in the vain hope i might smite the accursed thing with some piece of me thereby revealing its location i felt myself being reduced to hysterics in short order and my way along the thoroughfare now pleading with the article that it should return to my posein now vowing its certain and wholesale destruction when it did if i did not find this wretched ice bucket and procure some ice then surely the terrorists would win finally i sat down my physical exertion had once again produced a feeling of lightheadedness and nausea and i found it hard to breathe what with the peculiar tightness in my chest i am not any kind of athletic person after all my present dilemma being enough to daunt even the most splendidly capable brute i thought i did rather well for myself all things considered at least i had not lost consiue or been trod upon by any of the hotel i was a special operative deep behind enemy lines having suffered a string of indgtes but never to compromise my tactical imperative of stealth and concealment STRONG! why my very objective remained concealed even from me STRONG! when maureen appeared alongside me with the ice bucket in hand i was still crouched in the darkness contemplating my central role in the war and in the valiant cause of homeland security what next i remember was waking in bed with a damp towel across my head "

"seven the burden of my affections now it has never been a trademark of mine that i should enjoy particular mastery in beseeching the wily female to suspend better judgment in favor of gradually becoming naked in my company for years this woeful inadequacy this nettlesome spectre has haunted even the grandest of opportunities to this end i am usually resigned to despair from the outset i endeavor instead to invest myself in the few small things i can affect such as breathing through my nose instead of my mouth maintaining an appropriate posture and taking care not to hold hands lest mine prove unduly temperate these are small things hardly commensurate to the caliber of chicanery required for the american woman to remove her bra but whose aggregate weight i like to regard as working somehow in my favor and to their credit they have at times afforded me the calming knowledge that all bras must eventually be removed in one context or another of this we can be certain and as such so too will my beloved be removing hers even if it is several hours after our date while brushing her teeth for the moment maureen has since ended our spat of patriotism in favor of an hbo movie starring jessica lange i am watching it contentedly myself remarking occasionally on the points i find noteworthy or humorous it is not a very good film i am afraid and yet it seems to entertain nonetheless the strangeness of our circumstances are being consumed by the familiarity of this american pastime perhaps and naturally there is little question as to the effects of alcohol and the steadfast approach of midnight on women and on men maureen pulls me alongside her singlemindedly "
